WRITING.TITLE: My favorite person won't speak to me....
WRITING.TEXT: I'm really struggling right now. A couple of weeks ago, my FP told me that she needed a break from me. Ouch! Being my bpd self, I immediately went into the frantic efforts to avoid abandonment. I mean, she told me it's not forever, but I struggle to believe that and am quite convinced that she hates me and will never speak to me again. I try not to message her and let her have her space, but that's so hard for me to do. I feel like such an idiot for loving a person so much who seems to only tolerate my existence. I'm to the point of wishing that we had never become friends at all, because it would have saved me this heartache. Anyone have advice on giving your FP space so you don't end up pushing them away for good?

WRITING.TITLE: Boundaries
WRITING.TEXT: I have BPD and really struggle with the fear of abandonment....that being said, I seem to really struggle when friends try to "set boundaries" by doing things like not talking to me. I can't understand how you could hurt someone like that when you know what things they struggle with; I never could. I'm left feeling abandoned, forgotten, unimportant, and unloved. A big part of me wants to lash out at the person for cutting me off like they did, but I know deep down that doing so will just push them further away from me, and I certainly cannot handle that. I just don't know what to do, because this situation makes me even more depressed than usual and all I want to do is fix what seems to be broken. Anyone go through this? I'm really wondering how to navigate this period of silence without going crazy....
What I mean is that my fp said she needed a break and thus thus won't talk to me. She says it's her "setting boundaries"
I would love to talk things through with her, but that can't happen until she freaking talks to me again

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone out there an FP?
WRITING.TEXT: Hey all, so my FP hasn't spoken to me but once in the past 3 weeks, because she said she needed a break. This is KILLING me!!! I've tried checking in on her a couple of times, because I know she has a ton going on and I get worried, but to no avail :( I feel like our friendship is a stake if we don't get things figured out and I don't want to lose her. The thing is that we can't figure things out with her not speaking to me. Part of me is tempted to just show up (she lives out of state) and kinda force her hand in speaking to me so we can actually hash this out. Is this the worst idea ever?? Will she hate me if I do that??
Favorite person

Thanks for your thoughts. I ended up asking her what she thought about me visiting and she said we could just facetime so I don't have to spend the travel $. So we're actually going to talk everything through!!!

WRITING.TITLE: Wishing I didn't have a FP
WRITING.TEXT: Anyone else ever find themselves wishing they had never met their FP? I feel like much so much hurt could have been avoided had we never met. I love her more than anyone else in the world, but wish we had never met.

The struggle is real! I feel like my FP simply doesn't understand that I didn't choose her for this, it just happened and I can't take it back now. Does that make sense? Like, I like to think that I would leave if I could and save us both the heartache of being friends, but I just CAN'T.

I feel you, except I am totally insane when it comes to my FP and she knows it. I can rarely contain my crazy. It's gotten so bad that she recently had to take a break from me where we didn't speak at all; it nearly KILLED me. We've come to a place now where she has agreed to check in with me a certain number of times a week, but we don't talk otherwise. It's still tough for me, because if it was up to me we would talk every second of every day. I'm trying really hard though, because I know if I don't tone things down that I'll just push her away from me. I wish I had some advice for you, but I'm in almost the exact same boat. The only difference is that my FP knows that she's in that role in my life; that doesn't make things easier though. I applaud you for being able to control yourself and not freak your FP out, especially since you aren't actually close; that's hella difficult.

WRITING.TITLE: Maybe things are looking up with my FP
WRITING.TEXT: Been struggling with my relationship with my fp. She asked for a break and it was absolutely hell for me to wait to hear from her for so long. We are working things out and have agreed to a communication schedule to keep her from being overwhelmed by me and me from freaking out that she'll leave. I must admit that I'm actually kind of proud of myself for expressing what I needed in order to feel safe and loved so that we could work something like this out. It's not exactly ideal, but better than no communication at all.

I'm the same way! Doesn't help that my FP is a sickly person and I'm constantly worried about losing her anyway. I hate being so irrational! The tricky thing for me is that I knwo I'm being completely irrational, but can't seem to snap myself back into reality until I hear from her and KNOW for sure that she is ok. This can go on for days as we don't get to talk as much I'd like and I get so scared. I feel so dumb when she finally gets back to me and tells me that there's nothing wrong, she was just busy; I always imagine the worst though.

WRITING.TITLE: Guess the past is best left there
WRITING.TEXT: I reached out to an old friend after years of not seeing each other or talking. Nothing happened to our friendship, just drifted apart I suppose. We went out to lunch to catch up and it was literally the worst. I thought it would be good and I could share everything I've been dealing with for years that this friend has missed. Thing is, we just talked about her and she didn't ask how I was doing or anything. This was really upsetting to me as my depression and BPD already have a significant impact on my relationships and I really don't have friends these days. I guess I was hoping things would be like they used to be, but it wasn't even close. Now I'm super down and wishing I just never tried with anyone ever because I feel like no one cares about me or wants me around. Even though I know these thoughts are largely irrational, I can't help but find slivers of truth. Everyone says that adult friendships are tough, but it's so much worse with these issues running my mind.

In my experience, it's literally the worst. Not to discourage you, but just being honest. I struggle a ton with suicidal ideations and abandonment issues and I just can't seem to shake either. I have been in the psych ward 9 times now and did 5.5 months of residential treatment, but feel like I've actually just gotten worse over the years. They say DBT really helps though and I'm working on getting in with a DBT therapist. We shall see. I hope you have a smoother road to recovery than I have.

WRITING.TITLE: Splitting
WRITING.TEXT: I split on my FP today and now I feel absolutely terrible and so embarrassed about it. I definitely said f\*\*\* you in the angry email I sent and asked her why she doesn't just leave already. Ugh, I'm such an idiot sometimes and I don't really know how to change.

My psychiatrist has diagnosed me with BPD and so have other psychiatrists and past therapists. My current therapist thinks that I just have traits. It's actually kind of frustrating to me that she doesn't believe that I have BPD. How can she understand and properly work with me if she doesn't accept this diagnosis? Meanwhile, I am trying to get in with a DBT therapist because that's basically all that's left for me to try. Hopefully I'll find one that agrees with my diagnosis so that I can actually get the help I need.
Me too and I take 400mg
DBT is dialectical behavior therapy....it was specifically designed for BPD
Very well said!
My friend is a therapist in PA and has her medical card, she hasn't has any issues. It was the same for her in California.

WRITING.TITLE: Emotional Stunting
WRITING.TEXT: Just to preface I'm a 28 and have BPD, MDD, and GAD. I feel as though I stopped growing emotionally many years ago and am thus left unable to navigate this world on an emotional level. Maybe it's just the way with the BPD, but I'm not sure. Anyone else feel like they're stuck on an emotional level way below their actual age? I'm frustrated because this has left me with so much work to do to get myself to a better, more functional, place.

Hey there, I know how you feel thinking it won't get better. I can't say it will, but what I can do is encourage you to keep on trying. Even if trying your best doesn't mean working 40 hours, you're still doing YOUR best; and that's what matters. As for the meds issue, would it be cheaper to see your GP? Maybe they would keep you on your meds until you can get back in with your psychiatrist? I'm proud of you for ending a toxic relationship, even though it's probably been hell on you; it'll be better for you in the end. Keep your head up and always fight for yourself and your health! You got this, even when it feels like you don't.

If you know all of this about yourself earlier on than getting an actual diagnosis, it just gives you even more time to work on things. I mean, if they say that they don't diagnose at your age because our personalities are still developing, doesn't that mean you have time still to tweak bits of yours that are causing you trouble? I didn't realize what I was dealing with and ask a doctor about it until I was 23 and by then I was already pretty dead set in most of my ways. 5 years in, I still really struggle to control my symptoms and most days feel as though I can't do it; but I'm still holding out hope! I'm looking to start DBT therapy soon (it's basically all that's left for me to try) as it was specifically designed for BPD. I've heard that some people who go through DBT experience a remission of sorts of their symptoms and feel so much better. Don't get too wrapped up in a diagnosis, as a diagnosis doesn't define you. I would talk to a therapist about maybe incorporating some DBT work into your therapy routine (assuming you already attend therapy, that is.) I wish you the best of luck in fighting this demon, you can do it!
Dino is such a cutie! Feel better, catto!
Well if you ever need to talk in the middle of the night, hit me up! I work overnights so I'm almost always awake. I know a listening ear and someone to validate your feelings can go a long way.
Rest as much as you can, even if you can't sleep! I wish you a great day!

Hey there. I would say that for me, personally, this is common. I've lost most of my friends due to some of my BPD related behaviors. I tend to split on people and say things that I later regret. Unfortunately, most people don't know hot to handle this and opt to just leave. Luckily, my current FP is a therapist and she understands what is happening when I split on her and she knows how to deal with me. I'm not sure what to tell you about how to handle this besides to learn to be comfortable with being alone. But that's shit advice, right? Lol Much easier said than done. I know that being on here has certainly given me a sense of belonging because people actually understand me and they have similar experiences, so I feel less alone.

Don't let one slip up stop you from moving forward. You now know that you can make it at least a month and 9 days, so that means you can do that again and have the opportunity to keep it up for longer than that. Relapse is, unfortunately, part of recovery; but it isn't the end. You can do this!
That's awesome! Remember that every day is a victory, not just the big milestones. Keep up the good work!

On days like that, I just kinda have to go with the flow. It's important to remember that feelings and emotions don't last forever, even when they feel like they will. Do you have anything that can help pull you out of the hard stuff. I like to journal, color, or draw; it distracts my mind until my feelings shift.

WRITING.TITLE: Did a thing today
WRITING.TEXT: So, I'm pretty proud of myself tonight. I found a box cutter in the office at work and it has been staring at me for days, begging to be used. Today I asked my boss to remove it because it was super triggering to me. I'm about 3 months clean and I didn't want to do anything to mess that up.
Thank you!

I struggle with the thoughts still being there as well; but know that thoughts and feelings aren't fact and that they will pass if you sit with them and give them time to fade. You are doing so amazing for making it so long! Seriously, wow! I can only hope to one day make it so long as well. Keep up the amazing work and don't let your intrusive thoughts get the better of you; you got this!
Congrats! Amazing start on your recovery journey; keep it up!

Hey, don't get too down on yourself for a slip up. I know it can seem like all of your progress is gone, but know that it isn't. You know that you've made it a year and a half before and that means that you can most certainly do it again. Take care of your cuts and keep them clean so you don't get an infection. You can do this, I believe in you!

One thing I would say about being in the hospital is to remember that their goal is to get you stable enough to go back out into the "real" world. It's not meant to be a long term solution. Many of the times I've gone (been in inpatient in the psych ward 9 times) it was just a med adjustment and a place that I felt safe from myself until my intense suicidal thoughts had lessened. I think it's great that you're willing to still give life a chance and if going to the hospital is what helps you keep that mindset, then by all means, go. None of the hospitals I have been to have allowed smoking. Days are mostly spent going to groups, watching TV, reading, playing games, coloring, eating, and sleeping. One of the things that is always helpful for me is that you can be totally real because the other patients understand what you're dealing with and you don't feel alone in what you're going through. I wish you the best of luck and am proud of you for reaching out and wanting to keep trying!

I am the same way....I simultaneously hate and love this fact. It is comforting to me knowing that I can end things on my terms and am ready to do so. At the same time I hate it simply because I always have to tell my psychiatrist and therapist that I do have a plan, even when I'm feeling only passive SI. I hate that my mind works the way it does and that I think of these things. I hope you remain in a place in your mind that you don't actually want to act on your plan. Please, please get the appropriate help if you start to feel like acting on it!
What an amazing story! I'm so happy that you are still here today to share it with all of us!

I am on a cocktail of medications and have been for years. Despite this, I still have very very bad episodes and have been hospitalized numerous times since about 2016 when things starting getting really bad for me. Medications don't seem to do much, if anything for me, but my psychiatrist insists that I shouldn't stop taking them.
My therapist tells me that sleep tends to be my biggest "coping skill." I hate the things that I think about when I'm awake and sleep is my escape.

I think you'd be surprised by what your family may know and they just don't bring it up with you. My mom can always tell when I'm getting bad again, even before I tell her. I hope that you can find it within yourself to let them in and find help that could truly change your life!
That's fair, I suppose. Perhaps you can reach out to someone besides your family? Possibly a counselor?

Don't get too down on yourself, slip ups happen. What matters is that you realize that it happened and that you know that you don't want it to become a full blown issue again. You can beat this. Just focus on one day at a time, or less if you need to. Some days it's an hour or even a minute at a time for me, so I totally understand where you're coming from. Just don't let yourself think that you are doomed to a total relapse after one slip. Keep your head up and keep moving forward! You got this!

There is no timeline for life! You have to just go at your own pace. I know it's easier said than done, but try not to compare yourself to others and where they are in their journey. Take life at your own pace. Try to practice mindfulness and just live in the here and now, not the future or the past.
Thank you for posting this! Been struggling lately and this was a wonderful bright spot in the darkness.

I have been there and know that the pain seems unbearable. The good thing is that what you think you can't make it through is actually beatable. I know it feels like your world has come crashing down after losing your person, but I assure that it isn't. You are still here and still fighting the fight. Don't let someone else's choices dictate your life; stay for yourself, not another person. Just keep putting one foot in front of the other, you can get through this!
Beautiful work!

WRITING.TITLE: Fear and Blood. (TW: self harm)
WRITING.TEXT: I feel it again, the urge to let it out. I want to feel the pain, make my skin shout. #8203; I had a plan; over them up and I'd be done. But I failed quickly; the urges won. #8203; I dare not destroy the art that covers what I did in the past. But I've got plenty of skin for this obsession to last. #8203; I found a new place and let myself bleed. If only the scars could show my hurt, could be words for all to read. #8203; But they don't get why, the don't understand; how could this have been done by my own hand? #8203; It was easy you see, to grab draw the lines that I'd always see. And now it won't leave, like it's just another part of me. #8203; It is a battle I feel I will never win; I will just keep failing again and again. #8203; What's so wrong with it, I ask you all. Why can't I answer that siren call. #8203; They say it's not a healthy way to cope. But to me, it feels something like hope. #8203; As I drag the blade again and again, I am still alive; not giving in to the darker desires of my mind. It's all that keeps me from doing myself in and leaving this world behind. #8203; So how does one function without some sort of vice? It used to be different, I used to think twice. #8203; Now it's become the norm, the same old habit. These days in my blood and fear I sit.

WRITING.TITLE: My nephew and his best friend, our 150 mastiff

WRITING.TEXT: That is a huge deal! Congratulations! Keep it up!
Congratulations! Keep it up and you will hit the one year mark before you know it.
I definitely preferred Barcelona; it quickly became one of my favorite travel destinations.!

I put everything in storage while I was in Honduras for 5 months. Sold my car and broke the lease on my house. In retrospect, I probably should have kept the car, but it was definitely easier to pack everything else away than just leave it sitting.
Spain; particularly Barcelona and Zaragoza
I would suggest seeing a therapist first; they can refer you on if they feel it is needed.

I never learned how to properly study because I never needed to do so. I never even developed good study habits while I was in college. I don't think that, for me, this was the detrimental part of being labeled as gifted.What hurt me the most were the expectations of me. I was always quick to learn and good at my work, so my parents were just used it. Because of this, doing well on my school work was considered the norm and I never received any praise or affirmation that I was doing a good job. I personally think this led me to underachieve and rarely show my true potential because no one seemed to care as long as I kept getting good grades. I never really put my all into anything, because I didn't have to. As a result, I ended up in getting a degree in a field that I'm not actually super passionate about; I simply chose it because it came easily to me.

I have a similar story, so I can empathize with where you're coming from and what you did. I think the toughest thing about having lived, for me, is seeing the fear and pain in the eyes of my loved ones when I'm getting bad again. I am sure I traumatized my mother, who found me unresponsive, and I hate myself for that. My family has been super supportive through all of my mental health struggles, but at times I wish they weren't. I suppose that in my mind the lack of support would make it easier to off myself, like I often feel like doing. I am glad to hear that you are going to the psychiatrist soon! My psychiatrist is amazing and gives me one more person that is trying to help me and keep me safe. I hope you have a similar, positive experience. My hope for you is that you find a place in your mind that is calm and loving toward yourself so that you may find peace and purpose in staying alive.

I tend to waste most of my therapy time just talking about random things in my life before I get to what's really going on inside my mind. Even though I have been seeing my therapist for about 4 years now, I think it takes me time each session to get to a place where I am comfortable enough to discuss the important matters that I am there to work on.

WRITING.TITLE: "Seeing" images of what my death could look like.
WRITING.TEXT: I am really struggling lately with the pictures in my head. I often find myself creating images in my mind of what my suicide might look like. The images are often gruesome and disturbing, even though my plan isn't gruesome at all. These pictures leave me having suicidal ideations even worse than what I normally do when my mind just wanders to the thoughts, rather than what it might look like. I never experienced this until earlier this year and it scared me enough to take myself to the hospital when it first started. I was free from these images for a few months, but they have recently begun to reappear in my mind. I hate this and wish I knew of a way to stop it. My mind is a scary place.

My former therapist used to ask me to focus on my purpose in this world as a means of giving myself reason to keep on living. I have come to believe that my purpose is to serve others and help them find happiness, even if it's fleeting. I love helping people and making people smile; it makes me truly happy and helps me feel needed in the world. Perhaps you have a similar purpose and you staying alive might just lead to an opportunity where you can change the life of another. Keep moving forward and seek help when needed; you are not in this alone.
Congrats on your first 24 hours! The beginning is rough, but just keep moving forward; you got this!
Thank you for this, it really put a smile on my face. Namaste
I used to carry mine in my phone case. For some reason, knowing that I had it at all times helped me feel more in control of my urges; it was comforting to me for some reason.

I tend to cry when I'm talking about how serious my SI has gotten. My thoughts scare me and I hate them. I can't help but think about the people I would hurt and how much that upsets me. My therapist usually just lets me cry for a while before we start talking again.

When it comes to writing about what you're feeling, don't worry about knowing what to write. Writing in a journal has always been helpful for me and I sort of just jot down a stream of consciousness. It is nice to just get what you're thinking and feeling out of your mind for a bit.

WRITING.TITLE: Rainbow Bismuth that I am in love with!

WRITING.TEXT: It's about an inch long and 1/2 inch wide.

Just want to encourage you to talk to your doctor before doing this. Psych meds can have some pretty bad side effects if you stop them cold turkey. Perhaps your doctor will also have some ideas about different meds you can try.

Hey, I hate it for you that you're feeling this way. I understand what you're going through and want you to know that you are worth so much more than your mind tells you. I'm glad you posted here and reached out, it means you're still fighting; whether you realize it or not. Please stay safe and know that you are an amazing human being.

I understand that, as I also have a plan in place for my own death. I honestly hope that you hear only words that discourage this plan. I know it's tough when you've been dealing with shit for so long, but I truly believe that we can all get through this together.
Have you tried the crisis text line? I have always gotten through to them fairly quickly.
You are very talented! Thank you for sharing.

WRITING.TITLE: Why am I so obsessed?
WRITING.TEXT: I am really struggling with missing my FP and knowing that she doesn't love me as much as I love her. I realize that my love is kind of an obsession and isn't actually healthy, but I just cannot seem to change my thinking when it comes to my FP. I want to talk to her all the time and she simply doesn't have the time or energy for that. I've gotten better about not splitting on her when I feel ignored, because I know it is just my perception of the situation and not the reality. Unfortunately, I always think she is going to leave me and constantly feel the need to make sure she isn't. She has told me time and again that she won't leave and even shown it to me in my darkest hours, but I still struggle to trust this. I just want to have a "normal" friendship and not be so obsessed, but I don't seem to know how.

I struggle with this thought because I tend to wonder if maybe I have already fulfilled my purpose on this Earth and that's why I want so badly to leave it. The only thing that keeps me from believing this is the fact that I have survived numerous suicide attempts...there must be a reason for that, right? Surely something bigger than me was watching out for me and kept me around so that I can do even small things to make this world a better place for others.

I have MDD, BPD, and anxiety. I have been in therapy and on medications for quite some time trying to deal with these things. On days that I feel better, I find myself wishing that I didn't. The lows are where I have lived for so long that I am more comfortable feeling shitty than feeling okay. Sometimes I wonder if my illnesses are just a figment of my imagination that I have allowed to become my reality. I wonder if I have simply constructed this reality for attention, because people seem to care about me when they know that I am struggling.

Even if you just have that one string holding you back, it is still something; a bit of hope. Hold tight to that hope and let it guide you to better days. Screw anyone that tells you that you are less than worthy of living a beautiful life.

You are definitely not alone in this! I crave love and attention so much that I cling to the smallest things that people do for me or say to me. I don't really feel worthy of anyone's love, time, or attention so it feels great when I get those things, even from people I don't know.

Please try to remember that your current struggles are only temporary. You will get through all of your school things, even though it may be tough. Don't let a temporary thing cause you to make a decision that you cannot take back. I'm proud of you for posting here and letting people in, I know that's hard to do! Please try to stay safe and if you feel like you can't do that anymore, reach out for professional help. You can do this!

Thank you for sharing this with me! You have an amazing story and I'm so glad you're here to share it! I have a tough time believing that I have a purpose because my mental illness has stopped me from doing the things I feel like I was made to do. I'm trying to focus on the present and how I can use my gifts in a different way than what I thought before. Thanks again for sharing!

WRITING.TITLE: Greeted by this face after a week in the hospital lol
WRITING.TEXT: #8203; https://preview.redd.it/l7vwj9fyhwy41.jpg?width=1112 amp;format=pjpg amp;auto=webp amp;s=261109cc685c3410d696a66c89bf9090017f76f8

I think this is completely normal. It's actually part of why I go to therapy; just to have someone to talk to that I feel truly cares and will always hear me out. Sometimes, I feel like the things I think and say are kinda crazy so it's nice to have someone tell me that they aren't and help me to rationalize what is going on in my head.

Congratulations! I work at a rehab, and I see every day how hard it is to beat addiction. It hurts my heart to watch my clients struggle, but I love seeing them get better by the day. Stories like yours inspire those who are just starting out on their journey, so thank you for sharing. So happy that you are continuing to walk to road of recovery!
I try to believe that as well; it can just be hard when I have no idea what my reason for still being here might be.

Thank you all for your input! It has become easier since I've gotten used to the boundaries she has set, but I still hate that I am so wrapped up in someone. I just want it to be a normal (for me) friendship where we occasionally check in on each other, but it's not excessive. I am working on it for her sake because all I want to do is be the absolute best friend that I can be.
You are so kind to want to help others! I know that you will make a huge impact in the life of another!
Great use of a coping skill! I'm very proud of you for making it through the urges in this way!

This is amazing, thank you so much for sharing. I need something like this to remind me of what will happen if I kill myself. I know it would so badly hurt those around me and change their worlds entirely. This is a powerful reminder of that.
Happy birthday! Glad you're still with us and still pushing forward!
That Charoite is absolutely beautiful! I've never seen it before, but I'm in love with it!
Awesome job! I always feel so accomplished when I do even the smallest of tasks, can't imagine how great you feel after completing a large project like that.
I love this! So adorable!
Wow, you are incredibly talented!
This is so cool! Must've taken him quite some time.

I personally struggle with cleaning because I'm often just too worn out and tired from my depression. I just don't see the point in cleaning anymore, even when I know I'd be more comfortable in my apartment if it was clean.

This is a big struggle for me, as well! I have gotten better since my FP and I talked about it, though. We laid out days that I know are okay to check in with her and I know not to always expect answers on other days. This allows her to be more emotionally available when I need to talk because I'm not constantly bombarding her. I know before this I was almost always frustrated knowing that most people have their phones on them 24/7 and spend tons of time on them. I was constantly feeling ignored and that led to me feeling completely alone and unloved.
Oh my, how incredibly lovely! Now I need one!
Congratulations! I'm so proud of you and know you can keep it up!

WRITING.TITLE: Merida- pencil and watercolor
WRITING.TEXT: #8203; https://preview.redd.it/ybq3wvhu34z41.jpg?width=3024 amp;format=pjpg amp;auto=webp amp;s=48b609b7323a36d1f6e4f4a30722a62b534cb2cc

My biggest problem with a therapist that I stopped seeing was that she just didn't listen to me. I was there specifically to work on DBT and she made me go through a CBT workbook first. This was pointless since I spent 5 months in residential learning CBT things. I felt as though she didn't really let me just talk, because she was trying to "teach" me the whole time.

I am the same way when it comes to most people irl. I think the thing that seems to help me when posting here is that people really seem to get it. People out there in the real world rarely understand what I'm going through, so opening up to them just makes me feel more alone.
This hits home for me. I feel like I am doomed to always be a fucking mess mentally. Most of the time I'd rather off myself than continue to live in this darkness.

Hey there! I also have BPD and often feel very alone in my struggles. It's tough to feel like no one understands you, and I think that's why I like this community and the BPD pages...people seem to get it and are generally very supportive. Feel free to chat me up anytime, hopefully I can offer you some support as someone who knows the struggle of living with BPD.

I hate to say that I feel the exact same way. I was 15 the first time I remember wishing I was dead rather than someone else. I have always felt like my life is worth less than others and that they would be better off living than I am.

I find that the best thing my BFF can do for me is simply be there and be as supportive as she can be. It helps knowing I can talk to someone who isn't going to freak out about what I'm saying (she happens to be a therapist). Just knowing that there is someone out there that cares about me helps. You are a great friend for being there for him. Keep on letting him know that he is loved and special and encourage him to seek professional help.

I know I can be manipulative, but one thing I certainly am not is a liar. All I want to do is talk things through and figure out a better way forward in our friendship, but I'm always shut down and told that we need to take some time apart first; then the conversation never happens. I'm not even really mad, I'm just hurt. I just want things to work out and it's like she couldn't care any less about our friendship or even me for that matter. So much of me wants to be able to call it quits and walk away; but I feel like it would completely destroy me to do so. I don't know why I even feel like this since our relationship is so painful for me, too. Is it even possible to be the one that leaves in this situation? I feel like I'm too invested and obsessed to walk away.

Hey there. I don't think it's possible to go without having your loved ones affected. Our lives are intertwined with those of others in ways that we may not even imagine. For me, it's the thought of hurting my family that has kept me alive. Sometimes I try to tell myself that my death would be easier on them than seeing me live in pain all the time, but I'm always told that that thought is very wrong. They don't want to see you in pain, but being able to see you alive is infinitely better than never seeing you again. I try to put myself in their shoes and think about how I would react if my sister or someone killed themselves, and I know it would ruin me. I'm really sorry your life is rough right now. I'm not going to feed you any lines about it getting better, because I'm not sure it does. What I will say is that there are moments, even the tiniest ones, that make living worth it. Look for those little moments and hold on for just another second if that's all you can manage, then another after that, and another after that until time has gone by without your noticing. Stay alive, you can do this.

WRITING.TITLE: Therapy with my FP?
WRITING.TEXT: I am really struggling to maintain my friendship with my FP. Currently, she will not speak to me, and it is literally making me physically ill to think about everything being my fault. I think it might be beneficial for both of us to have a therapy session together so we can talk things out and have my therapist there to deescalate if needed. Anyone tried this before? Was it helpful or is this a terrible idea? I might also mention that my FP is a therapist. I feel like when she looks at me, she sees only my BPD and blames me for everything wrong in our friendship; taking into account nothing that she does that triggers me. Kinda feels like she only sees my reactions to things and just ignores the things that I am reacting to. I try to help her understand me and how my disorder affects my actions, but she just acts like she knows it all from her education on BPD.

Same. My FP is not a romantic partner, just a friend; but man, to me it feels like she hung the moon. I try to do so much to be a great friend, and it's just not reciprocated. I know that if we were both to be obsessed like I am, it would be awful; but I just want a little bit of effort on her part. It's like our friendship is totally one sided with me putting in all of the effort to keep it afloat. Then when I decide to ask for more from her, I'm being totally unreasonable and not respecting her boundaries. I just want to feel loved and important.
This. Then if only I could sit down with my loved ones and make them see that its really the best option for me. As a chronically suicidal and mentally ill person, I feel that this should be a thing.

ECT didn't help me at all, but things work differently for everyone. I had no trouble with getting back to work or anything like that. The time of my life around when I was getting my treatments is kind of foggy for me, but no terrible memory loss.
I completely understand, and I get to that point more than I care to admit. Other people are the only thing that keep me here, so I sometimes resent the fact that I do still care about them.

WRITING.TITLE: My ever growing little collection
WRITING.TEXT: #8203; https://preview.redd.it/p8d9itrhy6651.jpg?width=3024 amp;format=pjpg amp;auto=webp amp;s=a9c7197c7d36382054f8256a33362bb5055f2adc
Congrats! I work at a rehab, so I know how difficult the journey you're on is. I applaud you for your commitment to sobriety! Keep it up; one day at a time!

I appreciate the fact that you noted that it's things that *feel* offensive. It's like, it could be a totally normal comment, or even the lack of one that gets to me most of the time. Sure, there are times that I get upset over things that are actually offensive, but most of the time it's all in my head. Unfortunately, I don't really love myself, even when others show me love, or tell me they love me. I tend to believe that they're only acting that way or saying those things to me because they feel bad for me.

Right?!? One of my best friends is a therapist and she seems to act like everything I do is because of my illnesses. She acts like I should just be able to snap out of my episodes, when it's not nearly that simple. You would think a therapist would be more understanding, but I suppose it's because I'm not her job that she treats me the way she does.
For sure, I can never seem to shake the thought that I'm worthless and no one can really love me, it's always there in the back of my mind.

For me, it feels like mental anguish. It's like I need a physical representation of my pain to feel like it's actually real. I cut when I am in so much mental pain that I cannot explain it to even myself.
What is the bright green one in the front? I love its color!
Congrats on this huge accomplishment! Keep it up; one day at a time!

I lived in Honduras for about 5.5 months. I didn't go to learn or improve my Spanish; I was teaching English at a bilingual school. I wasn't allowed to speak Spanish with my students, but definitely got practice out in the community. My conversational skills improved just by listening to others and learning to use the local terms rather than the more formal ones I had learned in school. My grammar may not have been perfect, nor could I always remember the right words, but it felt great when I could converse with people and we understood one another. It was definitely worth it and made me much more confident in my Spanish speaking abilities. If you're a native English speaker, look into teaching in a Spanish speaking country; you're essentially getting paid to travel and get the added benefit of improving you language skills!
Hey there, glad you came here and put yourself out there. I hope you don't hurt yourself, it so quickly spirals out of control. You can do this without resorting to self-harm, I'm sure of it.

SAME! My FP can go months without texting me, but I can only make it a few days without contacting her. I hate this and wish it could just be like my other friendships where we only talk occasionally and it's cool. But noooooo, I will literally text her even when I know for a fact that she won't respond to me.

I had 12 ECT treatments and have been in the hospital 9 times. ECT was smooth sailing except for the fact that the time around when I was getting my treatments has become a bit hazy in my mind now. Not a time in my life I want to remember anyway, so I'm ok with it. Unfortunately, ECT didn't work for me; I really hope it does for you! They say it helps so many people! I totally get what you're saying about being in the hospital. I wouldn't say that I necessarily like being there, but I like feeling safe when my mind is an unsafe place.

I wouldn't say she blames me for having my illnesses, it's more that she blames me for everything that goes wrong in our friendship. I get that everyone has their limits, but she has vowed to not abandon me. She just likes to take breaks from me, which I don't handle well AT ALL. She actually used to be my therapist when I was in a residential facility, so I think some parts of our relationship as friends are just weird now. It was a shift for both of us in how we relate to one another, to say the least. I just want so badly to make things better, but all she wants to do is not talk to me. In my opinion, talking things out is far more beneficial than one of us ignoring the other.
I wish it was just that easy!

She's actually a very good therapist, but kind of a shit friend. She was my therapist before we became friends, so I know. When our relationship changed though, things got a bit sticky. Because she is now my FP, I tend to split on her, which I never did as her client. I guess that's a big part of why she gets so fed up with me. I wish I didn't split like I do, but it's become much more rare; hopefully I'll be able to get it under control and make things easier for both of us.

The safety there honestly depends on where you are. The bigger cities, like San Pedro Sula and Tegucigalpa can be quite dangerous. I lived in a small tourist town, though, so I felt completely safe there. It's really up to you how much of each language you speak. I spent time talking to the Spanish speaking teachers and we were basically conversation partners so they could practice English and I could practice my Spanish. There are also many opportunities to speak Spanish if you get out and about outside of school hours. For example, I attended a couple of Bible studies with the woman I lived with and those certainly helped to improve my listening skills.

I kinda feel the same way. I'm really open about my mental illnesses and my suicidal thoughts, so I'm sure most people are just expecting it to happen one day. I think anytime someone dies by suicide there's that typical "why didn't s/he say something? What could we have done to help prevent this" type of reaction. I know after I opened up about my last attempt people came out of the wood works to tell me how much they love me and that I ought to stick around.

In my experience, these relationships never turn out well. I have had 3 FPs in my time...one I pushed away, the second left, and I'm not on great terms with my current FP at the moment. I think it's perhaps because the relationship is too one sided where we love harder than what they can and it hurts us to not be loved in the same way. At least, that's been my experience. I tend to come off as smothering them when I'm just trying to show how much I care.
Same, drawing helps me feel slightly better since I can draw what I am thinking and feeling.
Honestly, ECT did nothing for me, so know that that is a possibility.

WRITING.TITLE: "Normal Adult Friendship"
WRITING.TEXT: Been going through a rough patch with my FP, but she says she feels like we are headed towards a "normal adult friendship" and she likes that. As I want to keep her happy, I really want to go with this. TBH, though, I guess I don't know what this is supposed to look like...?? Any thoughts on what a "normal" friendship looks like?

I am the same way...it's like, it takes 5 seconds to send a text. How busy can you be that you cannot find the time for that?!? I have BPD and my favorite person does this to me All. The. Time. She claims she's busy, but I hate that excuse. You make time for what you want to make time for, period. Just tell me you don't want to talk to me, since that's obviously the truth. Ugh.

I wasn't planning to take any languages in high school, but got stuck in Spanish 1 during my first semester of freshman year. I had an amazing teacher and realized I was pretty good at the subject; so I continued on to Spanish 2. Then, I had the opportunity to attend a Spanish school in Costa Rica for a week and that's what did it for me. I have since gotten my BA in Spanish and even got to live in Honduras and teach at a bilingual school for a bit. I have a tiny amount of French education under my belt, and would love to continue that as well.

This! even though I know what I'm going through is very very real, my real worry is that others will think that I am exaggerating because I seem to make it through life so well. The reality is though, I spend most of my days thinking about how much I want to die.

WRITING.TITLE: Actually Proud of Myself
WRITING.TEXT: TW: talk of suicude #8203; #8203; #8203; I am chronically suicidal, always thinking about how and when to best kill myself. That being said, I have been house sitting for my sister who, as far as I last knew, keeps a gun in her house. I have been fixated on this fact, but have resisted the urge to look for said gun. It would finally be SO easy to off myself versus the ways I have tried in the past, but for some reason I have been able to keep myself from searching out the weapon. This is HUGE for me.

I would totally send that. My therapist encourages me to email her if there are things I feel more comfortable writing about. She has even told me that we can just leave those things to the email and don't have to discuss them in session if I feel like I can't.
Thank you!

I am like this with my FP. I have recently gotten a bit better about splitting on her, but I still do things that are pushing her away; even after she has told me that they're starting to push her away.
A little over 5 years; with the exception of the exception of the time I spent in residential treatment.
You absolutely CAN do it! One week is huge! Keep it up

I have tried just about everything out there, including the things mentioned by others here. I have had 12 ECT treatments, around 30 TMS treatments, tried Spravato, and have been on almost every med you can try. In my personal experience, ECT did absolutely nothing for me. TMS was effective for a short period of time, but wore off. Spravato actually made my suicidal ideations worse after about 4 treatments, so my psychiatrist stopped the treatment. And as far as meds go, they only sort of help to control my symptoms; but I still experience severe depression, chronic suicidality, and anxiety. I don't want to discourage you from trying these things, as all can be rather effective for some people. Everything affects people differently. Just wanted to share my experiences with you. Best of luck in finding something that is right for you!

I mean, it is what it is.I go to therapy weekly, and talking about things is at least semi helpful. I still have my times where I get extremely upset about the fact that nothing has worked and that I'll be dealing with this for the rest of my life. Often that reality leaves me not wanting to live, but I do my best to keep myself safe. The only thing that happened from ECT is that the time right around my treatments is kind of hazy for me and I have trouble remembering it. But that only applies to the time close to treatments; my memory is fine otherwise.
They won't 5150 you for self-harm. Just be honest with your therapist.
The depth of your cuts is not reflective of the hurt that caused you to make them. Your hurt is valid.

So happy to hear that you have a great support system; it makes such a big difference!
Pringles and video games, I love it! :)
Could always be something great!

I tell my therapist everything. I guess I figure it would feel like a waste of time for both of us (and a waste of money for me) if I withheld things from her. Plus, I wouldn't really be working on any of the things that I truly need to work on if I hid them.

WRITING.TITLE: I quit my job yesterday and I feel great!
WRITING.TEXT: Recently, the supervisor that I absolutely adored left and was replaced by a promoted coworker that I absolutely cannot stand. I just know that work will become a hostile and toxic environment for me if I stay and I don't want that, so I put my 2 weeks notice in. I am finally doing something good for myself and putting my well being first. I am happy to report that I already have an interview with another company! Fingers crossed that I'll find something great! #8203; Update...I didn't get the first job I interviewed for; but the employer said it was solely because she couldn't give me as many shifts as I need. It was nice to be told that I did great at an interview and that she thought I would be great at the job if she'd had more work for me. I tend to believe things happen for a reason, though, so I'm sure there's still something out there for me.
My employer isn't happy about it and really tried to get me to stay; but I stood up for myself and my decision.
Thank you!

I love helping people, in whatever manner that might be. The job I just quit is at a substance abuse rehab facility and it has been truly amazing to be even a small part of each client's journey. I love watching the clients grow and change from when they first get here. I also love teaching; I actually spent some time teaching English in Honduras and that is really my passion...just don't feel like I'm stable enough mentally to be out of the country alone again, unfortunately.

I started ECT when I was 25 and had 12 treatments within that year. I deal with very severe depression and nearly constant suicidal ideations. ECT was basically the only option for me left to try after multiple suicide attempts. Unfortunately, the treatments had no effect on me.
Good for you for reaching out for help!

Lots of meds that sorta control my symptoms. I still have horrible suicidal ideations on the daily, but I'm getting better about at least not letting them get the better of me. I go to the hospital to keep myself safe if it gets too bad. I tried the ketamine thing as well and just ended up back in the hospital. I stay in therapy every 1-2 weeks and just having someone to talk to is nice. Honestly, I'd even be game to try some sorta medical study to see if anything new would help. I am trying to accept that maybe this is just as good as it gets for me.
Just don't give up on what you feel will be best for you! Keep pushing!

WRITING.TITLE: Cannot get over Mr. Swayze's eyes!

WRITING.TEXT: I once had a therapist tell me she couldn't help me. I suppose her intentions were good and she just wanted me to find someone else who could actually be of help to me, but man did it feel shitty. I have BPD and I know people often say that clinicians don't really like working with people like me, but I certainly didn't expect this to happen. I still think about this and wonder if I'm just too fucked up and beyond help.
Lol, I'll have to mention that to his owner! I doubt she even realized she could refer to him as that when she named him.

Thank you for this reminder. I actually have a therapist now that I really like, it's just hard to shake the memory of being told that the other one couldn't help me. I think perhaps she could have worded it better when telling me; by saying that she thought I needed someone more suited to my specific needs.

I have tried, the therapist that I went to wasn't great and wanted to make me work through a CBT workbook first. I did 5 months in residential and know CBT like the back of my hand, so it was super frustrating to me. My current therapist is great, she just always asks me how I feel if this is as good as it gets for me. Kinda disheartening,

That's awful, that's when you need your therapist the most. BPD is rough and everyone always says that most clinicians don't like working with us. I have been lucky to have two good therapists, it just feels like I'm always saying the same things though, and can't change things no matter how hard I try. My therapist and psychiatrist seem to agree that my suicidal thoughts will probably never go away. Talk about something that makes you feel hopeless.

I agree. And people always over simplify it by saying that if you just force yourself to do the things that you'll feel better. In my experience, though, that is far from true. It's like, how is showering going to help me? It's not.
General anxiety, major depression, and BPD here
Therapy is different for everyone. I don't think you really find ways to "fix" issues, but you gain tools to better deal with things that you are going through.
